title: Bisquick Peach Cobbler Recipe
description: This Bisquick peach cobbler recipe makes an easy and delicious old-fashioned dessert of canned juicy peaches made with a simple baking mix batter.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Bisquick Peach Cobbler 4.5 (195) 172 Reviews 61 Photos This easy Bisquick peach cobbler can be made with canned, fresh, or frozen peaches, depending on the time of year. Whatever the season, this homey dessert will bring you praise. Try this favorite tonight! Submitted by Bisquick Updated on June 24, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 61 61 61 61 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Yield: 1 (8x8-inch) dish Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup Original Bisquick mix 1 cup milk ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg ½ cup butter or margarine, melted 1 (29 ounce) can sliced peaches, drained 1 cup sugar Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir together Bisquick mix, milk, and nutmeg in an ungreased 8x8-inch baking dish until batter is smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in melted butter until blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir together peaches and sugar in a large bowl until combined; spoon over batter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 50 to 60 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 573 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 427 Calories 19g Fat 63g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 427 % Daily Value * Total Fat 19g 25% Saturated Fat 11g 56% Cholesterol 44mg 15% Sodium 383mg 17% Total Carbohydrate 63g 23% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 50g Protein 4g 8% Vitamin C 5mg 6% Calcium 91mg 7% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 266mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Bisquick Peach Cobbler 01 of 61 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 61 Photo by  Debbie 12/08/2024 It was delicious! I used a jar of peaches and a little cinnamon because I didn’t have nutmeg. I fallowed the recipe and it turned out great! The only thing I might have changed was the amount of sugar, I don’t think it needs a full cup. Maybe 1/2 or 3/4 cups. 03 of 61 Photo by  Furaha Linda 11/19/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Great flavors It is so simple and easy to make. I used cane sugar,2 tbso vanilla and 1/4 each nutmeg and cinnamon. I made made two in two days using canned Peaches 🍑 04 of 61 Photo by  Darlene Lilbit Findley 05/23/2024 I used pie filling I already had and doubled the recipe. A little ad-lib with walnuts on top,made it easy a delicious. 05 of 61 Photo by  katbw29 05/14/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser I used fresh peaches and a handful of blueberries. Topped with a sprinkle of brown sugar and cinnamon. 06 of 61 Photo by  Annalee K Trimm Irwin 01/19/2024 The recipe is very easy and quick. The only thing I did wrong was not mix the peaches and the sugar! I forgot! So after I had the peaches in the batter, I just spread the cup of sugar over the top. I will make this again, but maybe add more nutmeg and cinnamon to the mix. 07 of 61 Photo by  nanet 12/11/2023 Tasted fine but it did not have enough batter. I modified by adding double the amount of bisquick & it was delicious. I also cut the amount of sugar in half as I was using canned peaches. 08 of 61 Photo by  ToastyOkra8624 01/30/2023 I made lots of changes out of the gate just from reading the original recipe and the first couple of reviews. I knew I would need to doctor up this recipe for it to be a hit for me. First recommendation is to cook the 🍑 peaches. I used two cans instead of 1, plus one can of water. Add the sugar, the water, nutmeg, and butter to a medium sauce pan. I cut the sugar by about 1/4 cup. Cook the peaches for about 20 minutes or until the peaches become tender. 09 of 61 Photo by  Jan Short 01/16/2023 Loved it! Added more biquick and sugar on top. About 50 min. Bake time. 10 of 61 Photo by  tf seem 08/25/2022 Really good! But I also made a couple changes ... a few tablespoons more of the Bisquick mix because batter seemed a bit watery, only used 1/2 cup sugar (1 cup seemed like A LOT), and added some leftover blueberries because ... why not? 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Butter Biscuit Peach Cobbler 68 Ratings Marie's Peach Dump Cake 88 Ratings Easy Peach Cobbler 396 Ratings Peach Jello Dump Cake 95 Ratings Fruit Cobbler from Mott's 19 Ratings Great Grandma's Peach Cobbler 164 Ratings Quick Peach Cobbler 59 Ratings Easy Southern Peach Cobbler 520 Ratings Easy Stovetop Peach Cobbler 65 Ratings Fresh Fruit Cake 2 Ratings Instant Pot Peach Cobbler 1 Rating Peach Cobbler (Celiac-Friendly) 2 Ratings Lazy Peach Cobbler 44 Ratings Peach Kuchen 171 Ratings Easy Peach Cobbler II 192 Ratings Easiest Ever Fruit Cobbler 65 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Bisquick
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir together Bisquick mix, milk, and nutmeg in an ungreased 8x8-inch baking dish until batter is smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in melted butter until blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir together peaches and sugar in a large bowl until combined; spoon over batter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 50 to 60 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
